IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: TO FURTHER THE MISSION OF ITS SUPPORTED ORGANIZATIONS BY PROVIDING MANAGEMENT, CONSULTING AND OTHER SUPPORT SERVICES TO THOSE ORGANIZATIONS AND BY PROVIDING SERVICES TO THE COMMUNITY
IRS990.MissionDescription: TO FURTHER THE MISSION OF ITS SUPPORTED ORGANIZATIONS BY PROVIDING MANAGEMENT, CONSULTING AND OTHER SUPPORT SERVICES TO THOSE ORGANIZATIONS AND BY PROVIDING SERVICES TO THE COMMUNITY, A LIFELINE EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM FOR THE ELDERLY AND INJURY MANAGEMENT FOR EMPLOYEES AND BUSINESS COMMUNITY. THE TAKE CHARGE COMMUNITY HEALTH RISK SCREENING PROGRAM WAS DEVELOPED TO PROVIDE A COST EFFECTIVE WAY FOR INDIVIDUALS, PARTICULARLY UNDERSERVED POPULATIONS, TO LEARN MORE ABOUT THEIR HEALTH. TO DATE THIS PROGRAM HAS SERVED A LITTLE OVER 9,378 INDIVIDUALS WITH ABOUT 36% BEING FEMALE AND 64% MALE. THE MAJORITY OF THOSE FOLKS WERE OF WORKING AGE (OVER 60%), WITH THE REMAINING INDIVIDUALS BEING RETIRED. WHILE THE AVERAGE AGE BRACKET OF THE PARTICIPANTS IS BETWEEN 30-49 YEARS OF AGE, WELL OVER HALF OF THOSE SCREENED THIS YEAR ALONE (57%) FELL INTO THE CATEGORIES OF EITHER MODERATE OR HIGH RISK FOR A HEART-RELATED ILLNESS.
IRS990.Description: PHYSICIAN PRACTICES: GENERAL SURGERY, NEUROSURGERY AND ORTHOPEADIC PRACTICES PROVIDING HEALTH CARE SERVICES TO CHILDREN AND ADULTS THROUGHOUT THE STATE OF MAINE.

Activity2.Description: OCCUPATIONAL/EMPLOYEE HEALTH: A PROGRAM DESIGNED TO PROVIDE SCREENING AND INJURY MANAGEMENT FOR ITS EMPLOYEES AND BUSINESS COMMUNITY.

Activity3.Description: NUTRITION CENTER: STRIVES TO BE A COMMUNITY RESOURCE AND WORKS TOWARDS PROMOTING OVERALL COMMUNITY WELLNESS AND PROVIDING ALL PEOPLE WITH ACCESS TO NUTRITIOUS FOOD, THE OPPORTUNITY TO LEARN AND IMPLEMENT HEALTHY AND SAFE EATING PRACTICES.

ActivityOther.Description: INTERPRETIVE SERVICES: A SERVICE FOR PEOPLE THAT NEED ASSISTANCE WITH THE UNDERSTANDING OF THE ENGLISH LANGUAGE.
PREVENTION & WELLNESS: A PROGRAM FOR INDIVIDUALS IN THE COMMUNITY TO BETTER UNDERSTAND THEIR HEALTH NEEDS AND TO PROVIDE EDUCATIONAL TOOLS FOR THE INDIVIDUALS TO USE.

LOTS TO GARDEN: IS A YOUTH AND COMMUNITY DRIVEN ORGANIZATION THAT USES SUSTAINABLE URBAN AGRICULTURE TO CREATE ACCESS TO FRESH FOOD, AND TO NURTURE HEALTHY YOUTH AND A HEALTHY COMMUNITY. TO TEACH PEOPLE HOW TO GROW FOOD, PROVIDE AFFORDABLE ACCESS TO FRESH FOOD AND INVOLVE YOUTH AS LEADERS.
FOOD PANTRY: THE PANTRY GIVES FOOD TO THOSE WHO WOULD OTHERWISE GO WITHOUT. THE FOOD PANTRY PROVIDES FOOD TO ABOUT 200 FAMILIES PER WEEK.
LIFELINE EMERGENCY RESPONSE: A MEDICAL ALERT SERVICE FOR INDIVIDUALS TO HAVE INSTANT ACCESS TO HELP FROM THEIR HOME.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: RENT EXPENSE RECLASS 884,943. FUNDRAISING EVENTS RECLASS 26,505.
RENT EXPENSE RECLASS 884,943. FUNDRAISING EVENTS RECLASS 26,505.

AcctsActvsOutUSTable.TypeOfActivitiesConducted: THE ORGANIZATION EMPLOYED ONE INDIVIDUAL IN THE REGION WHO WORKED FROM HIS HOME.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: THE PRESIDENT, THE CEO OR THE CFO MAY AUTHORIZE PAYMENT OF SPOUSAL TRAVEL EXPENSES. THE PAYMENT OF SUCH AMOUNTS ARE TREATED AS TAXABLE COMPENSATION AND REPORTED ON FORM W-2 OR 1099 AS REQUIRED. THE PRESIDENT RECEIVED TAX INDEMNIFICATION PAYMENTS RELATED TO A SUPPLEMENTAL RETIREMENT PLAN. THE PAYMENTS ARE REPORTED AS TAXABLE COMPENSATION AND INCLUDED IN THE REASONABLENESS REVIEW OF COMPENSATION. THE CEO RECEIVED TAX INDEMNIFICATION PAYMENTS RELATED TO A SUPPLEMENTAL RETIREMENT PLAN. THE PAYMENTS ARE REPORTED AS TAXABLE COMPENSATION AND INCLUDED IN THE REASONABLENESS REVIEW OF COMPENSATION.

LEO MYLES RECEIVED A SUPPLEMENTAL EMPLOYEE RETIREMENT PLAN CONTRIBUTION OF $182,000. THE AMOUNT IS INCLUDED IN TAXABLE WAGES IN 2010. JAMES CASSIDY RECEIVED A SUPPLEMENTAL EMPLOYEE RETIREMENT PLAN CONTRIBUTION OF $136,381. THE AMOUNT IS INCLUDED IN TAXABLE WAGES IN 2010.

IN CONJUNCTION WITH ITS SOLE MEMBER, COVENANT HEALTH SYSTEMS, THE ORGANIZATION MAINTAINS AN INCENTIVE COMPENSATION PLAN FOR EXECUTIVES THAT IS ADMINISTERED BY COVENANT HEALTH SYSTEM'S COMPENSATION COMMITTEE. THE PLAN PROVIDES EXECUTIVES WITH THE OPPORTUNITY TO EARN REASONABLE INCENTIVE COMPENSATION BASED ON THE PERFORMANCE OF THE INDIVIDUAL EXECUTIVE, AS MEASURED AGAINST GOALS THAT ARE SET AT THE BEGINNING OF THE YEAR.

IssuerName.BusinessNameLine1: VARIABLE RATE REVENUE BONDS - SERIES 2009 FINANCE AUTHORITY OF MAINE

GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ADOLESCENT GROUP HOME PROGRAM, WHICH PROVIDED A HOME-LIKE ENVIRONMENT FOR FEMALE AND MALE YOUTH WITH EMOTIONAL PSYCHIATRIC AND BEHAVIORAL PROBLEMS, WAS DISCONTINUED IN 2010. THE PROGRAMS WAS TRANSITIONED TO BECKET FAMILY SERVICES WHERE THESE YOUTHS WILL CONTINUE TO RECEIVE THE SUPPORT AND NURTURING NEEDED TO ATTAIN THE SKILLS NECESSARY TO FUNCTION MORE INDEPENDENTLY.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 6
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION HAS A SOLE CORPORATE MEMBER.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE SOLE CORPORATE MEMBER MAY APPOINT OR REMOVE ONE OR MORE MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7B
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: CERTAIN DECISIONS OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS ARE SUBJECT TO APPROVAL BY THE SOLE CORPORATE MEMBER.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: FORM 990 IS PROVIDED TO THE BOARD MEMBERS AND REVIEWED AT THE JULY MEETING.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THIS PROCESS IS THE RESPONSIBILITY OF ORGANIZATIONAL INTEGRITY OFFICER. A FORM IS USUALLY SUBMITTED TO ALL LEADERSHIP, BOARD MEMBERS, BOARD COMMITTEE MEMBERS, EMPLOYED PHYSICIANS, MEDICAL DIRECTORS AND CERTAIN EMPLOYEES IN KEY POSITIONS (I.E. PURCHASING STAFF) ANNUALLY TO BE COMPLETED. REMINDERS ARE USUALLY SENT TO MAKE CERTAIN ALL CONFLICT OF INTEREST FORMS ARE RETURNED.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: EVERY TWO TO THREE YEARS THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE OF THE COVENANT HEALTH SYSTEMS BOARD OF DIRECTORS ENGAGES AN EXTERNAL CONSULTANT TO PROVIDE COMPETITIVE MARKET DATA FROM VARIOUS SURVEY SOURCES, WHICH IS USED TO DEVELOP RECOMMENDATIONS FOR CHANGES TO THE COMPENSATION PROGRAM. SINCE 2003, THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE HAS ENGAGED MERCER HUMAN RESOURCES CONSULTING TO CONDUCT THIS ANALYSIS. OBJECTIVES ARE TO ASSESS THE COMPOSITENESS OF THE CURRENT TOTAL CASH COMPENSATION LEVELS OF THE SENIOR LEADERSHIP TEAM; DEVELOP MARKET BASED COMPETITIVE SALARY RANGES FOR ALL EXECUTIVE POSITIONS AND ENSURE THAT THE ANNUAL INCENTIVE OPPORTUNITIES, IF THERE ARE ANY, ARE COMPETITIVE AND REASONABLE.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION PROVIDES FORM 1023 TO THE PUBLIC WHEN REQUESTED AND FORM 990 IS AVAILABLE ON OUR WEBSITE. THE ORGANIZATION DOES NOT CURRENTLY PROVIDE ACCESS TO GOVERNING DOCUMENTS CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY OR FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: CHANGES IN NET ASSETS OR FUND BALANCES:
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: NET UNREALIZED GAINS ON INVESTMENTS: 325,729. NET TRANSFERS -501,559. TOTAL TO FORM 990, PART XI, LINE 5: -175,830.
